content: Office skyscraper in Singapore **Guoco Tower** is a [mixed-use development](/wiki/Mixed-use_development) skyscraper in [Tanjong Pagar](/wiki/Tanjong_Pagar) of the [Downtown Core](/wiki/Downtown_Core) district of Singapore. With a height of 290 m (950 ft), it is currently the [tallest building in Singapore](/wiki/List_of_tallest_buildings_in_Singapore#Tallest_buildings), breaking the record held jointly by [UOB Plaza](/wiki/UOB_Plaza), [One Raffles Place](/wiki/One_Raffles_Place) and [Republic Plaza](/wiki/Republic_Plaza,_Singapore) for more than 20 years. ## Background Formerly known as the **Tanjong Pagar Centre**, the 65-storey, 1.7 million sq ft skyscraper was developed by [GuocoLand](/wiki/GuocoLand) and designed by [Skidmore, Owings & Merrill](/wiki/Skidmore,_Owings_%26_Merrill). It is the headquarters of Guocoland Limited (Singapore) and is the only skyscraper exempted from the height restriction of 280m. Guoco Tower houses the rooftop Urban Park, the Wallich Residence apartment complex, and a hotel by [Sofitel Hotels & Resorts](/wiki/Sofitel). The tower also has a mall, which includes a variety of food options like City Hotpot and Ah Lock & Co. and Aburi-EN. The development won the 2014 World Architecture News Mixed-Use Award in the Future Projects category, and was [shortlisted](/wiki/Shortlist) for the 2015 [World Architecture Festival](/wiki/World_Architecture_Festival) Commercial Mixed-Use Award in the Future Projects category. ## Notable residents In July 2019, British industrialist and designer [James Dyson](/wiki/James_Dyson) purchased a 21,108 square foot (1,961.0 m2) triplex [penthouse apartment](/wiki/Penthouse_apartment) at the top of the building for £43 million (US$52.8 million). He later sold the flat in October 2020 for £36 million to Chinese American businessman [Leo Koguan](/wiki/Leo_Koguan). - [List of tallest buildings in Singapore](/wiki/List_of_tallest_buildings_in_Singapore) - [Architecture of Singapore](/wiki/Architecture_of_Singapore) - Singapore portal RecordsPreceded by[UOB Plaza](/wiki/UOB_Plaza) [One Raffles Place](/wiki/One_Raffles_Place) [Republic Plaza](/wiki/Republic_Plaza_(Singapore)) **[Tallest building in Singapore](/wiki/List_of_tallest_buildings_in_Singapore)** 283.7 m (931 ft) 2016–Succeeded byCurrent This article about a Singapore building or structure is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Guoco Tower
